snippet: In a 5-to-4 ruling, the Supreme Court said DNA samples were similar to the photographs and fingerprints taken while booking criminal suspects.
abstract: Supreme Court rules in 5-to-4 decision that police may take DNA samples from people arrested in connection with serious crimes; federal government and 28 states authorize practice, and law enforcement officials say it is valuable tool for investigating unsolved crimes; in ruling, however, high court says testing is justified by different reason: to identify suspect in custody.
lead_paragraph: In a 5-to-4 ruling, the Supreme Court said DNA samples were similar to the photographs and fingerprints taken while booking criminal suspects.

headline.seo: Supreme Court Says Police Can Take DNA Samples
headline.main: Justices Allow DNA Collection After an Arrest
headline.print_headline: Justices Allow DNA Collection After an Arrest
